page.title: 03RECTORY PARK
page.content: Rectory Park covers much of our square kilometre. It is an expanse of grassland measuring approximately 3 acres which is open to the public use at any time and for any purpose. Children can be seen there after school and at weekends enjoying their games. Joggers exercise around the park and of course it is an ideal place to walk a dog! There are cricket stands for that relaxing game on a sunny Sunday afternoon; goalposts for budding international soccer players and pitches for rugby and American Football. For the younger age group there are swings,slides,climbing frames,sand pit and monkey bars. If you don't feel so energetic, why not come to Rectory Park to relax? On a hot summers day,bring your swimsuit to sunbathe. You could bring a picnic and sit and watch the world go by.
